<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 16"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Portentous Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=1506) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
<trait label="Metamagic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=107" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 81 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

Your spellcasting is rife with strange lights, esoteric gestures, and other captivating effects that befuddle your foes. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell, any creature that attempts to use a reaction triggered by your Cast a Spell activity takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and skill checks rolled as part of the reaction. In addition, if the spell includes a spell attack roll or requires a saving throw, creatures you hit or that fail their saves are [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14) with you until the start of your next turn.
name: Portentous Spell
